body.p: Enclosed you will find the oath required, & the Secretarys fee of five Dollars,

Yours truly,
Jno. A. Staley
J. P.

Hon. T. B. Monroe, Jr.
Sec'y of State,
Frankfort,
Ky.

Personally came and appeared before me Laurence Connell a Justice of the Peace in and for the county and State aforesaid, Jno. A. Staley J. P. who being duly sworn says that he will, to the best of his knowledge and ability, discharge all the duties required of him as Commissioner for the State of Kentucky in the State of Georgia.
In Witness whereof he hath hereunto affixed his signature, this 4th. day of March, 1861.

Sworn to before me
Laurence Connell J. P.

Georgia
Oath
Jno. A. Staley
Comr. of Deeds
